output_list.description: Integer overflow in distribute function allows unauthorized increase of tokens, exploitable in real world and beneficial to attackers.
Minting tokens is only allowed by the contract owner, which can be exploited by malicious actors to mint more tokens.
Freezing accounts is only allowed by the contract owner, which can be exploited by malicious actors to freeze accounts.
Setting buy and sell prices is only allowed by the contract owner, which can be exploited by malicious actors to manipulate the prices.
Buying tokens with Ether allows for integer overflow, which can be exploited by malicious actors to buy more tokens than available.
Selling tokens for Ether allows for integer overflow, which can be exploited by malicious actors to sell more tokens than they own.
